page.title: 16A View of Ponsanooth.
page.content: Ponsanooth (PONSNOWETH) is Cornish for New Bridge. It is set in a pleasant wooded valley. E.Thomas are expanding the village by helping to build a new estate. In the village the housing is mainly made up of two stone built terraces which are up to a hundred years old. Like Stithians the village is surrounded by farms and small holdings. The main Redruth to Falmouth road runs through the middle of the village which is very busy during the summer time when the county is infested with tourists. There is a Post office and general stores combined, a hair dresser, a vet's surgery, a paint shop and a small garden centre. There is a popular pub,a garage, a church and a chapel. There is a squash club just outside and youth club which is also for people from Mabe.(Pop. 1030 in 1979)
